official_title: A bill to prohibit use or sharing of medical health records or information by financial institutions and their affiliates, and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Health Information Protection Act of 2000 - Amends the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act to prohibit financial institutions and their affiliates from either sharing or using medical information and health records with respect to a consumer without the consumer's affirmative written consent. Exempts from this prohibition the sharing of specified information in connection with the collection of or payment of a medically related debt or insurance claim.
